revised_title: Joint Solar Eclipse Committee's Observations of the Solar Eclipse of April 16, 1893
tldr: The Joint Solar Eclipse Committee of the Royal Society, the Royal Astronomical Society, and the Solar Physics Committee conducted observations of the solar eclipse of April 16, 1893, using photographic methods. They obtained valuable photographs of the corona, surroundings of the Sun, and the spectrum of the corona from two observing expeditions in Senegambia and Brazil. The results provide a large amount of material for further analysis and comparison.
